I'm checking into the news services regarding the 9.0 magnitude earthquake which struck the Indian Ocean early this Sunday. The devastation ranges from Indonesia/Sumatra to India and just about everywhere in between. The initial death toll is placed at 11,800, and that number will almost certainly rise once rescue teams reach isolated coastal towns. Expect health epidemics to increase the death toll in one of the most poverty stricken areas of the world. 
 
 In Northern California, we routinely experience earthquakes of magnitude 5.0 to 6.0. The idea of a 9.0 quake is mind-numbing.
 
 I visited the local mall this afternoon and watched as shoppers returned their Christmas gifts for refund or exchange. Perhaps it's an unfair observation, but I experienced a certain disconnect.
 
 As of this morning, the death toll has climbed to 21,000. 
 
 Merry Christmas.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  For PC Holiday Party-Poopers
